comments:
CDT 2.0.0.200404281729
Eclipse (200404281424)

The search dialog contains a radio button that allows users to reduce their
search scope to the selected resource.  The problem is that the term "selected
resource" is too broad at the moment.

Example:  If my C/C++ Projects view and Navigator view have nothing selected,
but my Search view (for example) has something selected and the view is active,
then the option button becomes available and search will not work if this scope
is selected.

This radio button should only become enabled if the active view is either the
C/C++ Projects or Navigator view AND something is selected within.

Exception is:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 May 06, 2004 17:07:35.851

*** Bug 60404 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Changed the CSearchScope creation to take all types of elements present in the 
CDT. Selected Resources will now work from: Navigator, C/C++ Projects, Search 
Pane, Outline view, Make View.

- BG

This bug has been verified for Eclipse build 20040628 and CDT build  
200406301134, and it passes.

Pixy.
